175.title: IAS officer Pooja Singhal suspended by Jharkhand govt after being arrested by ED
175.article_body: Jharkhand government has suspended State Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal in connection with a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. The IAS officer was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday. A viral video earlier showed over ₹17 crore in cash being recovered during a raid at the house of a CA linked to her.

176.title: Russia 'most direct threat' to world order, its pact with China worrying: EU
176.article_body: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen said that Russia "is today the most direct threat to the world order with the barbaric war against Ukraine and its worrying pact with China". The remarks came after her meeting with Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, who backed it up saying that Russia's action is not just a matter for Europe but Asia also.

177.title: Replacing Chahal is no mean feat: RCB spin bowling coach Sriram on Hasaranga
177.article_body: RCB spin bowling coach Sridharan Sriram said spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has handled the pressure and expectations brilliantly in the ongoing IPL season after being bought for ₹10.75 crore at the mega auction. "Replacing Yuzvendra Chahal at RCB is no mean feat...and to come and fill in his boots and be second on the [wicket-takers'] list is brilliant," he added.

178.title: SoftBank's Vision Fund reports record $26 billion loss
178.article_body: Japan's SoftBank Group reported a record $26.2 billion loss at its Vision Fund investment arm on Thursday. The group also reported a net loss of $13.2 billion for the financial year that ended March 31. This is reportedly its biggest full-year loss which followed a nearly $38.8 billion net profit in the previous fiscal year.

179.title: Pant should not even try doing what MS Dhoni does now: Ajay Jadeja
179.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said DC captain Rishabh Pant "should not" even try doing what MS Dhoni does currently, adding that Pant should do what Dhoni used to do at his age. "Pant is a young player but [it] feels like he's been made a senior statesman very early," stated Ajay. Dhoni's current strike rate in IPL 2022 is 139.31.

180.title: Pune ZP to develop its land on Sinhagad Fort for heritage purposes
180.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has decided to develop the land it owns on the top of Sinhagad Fort to promote tourism and heritage activities at the monument. "We have asked private agencies to come forward and submit a development plan for the land," said Yuvraj Desai, Executive Engineer of Pune ZP. E-bus facility to reach monument was also launched recently.

181.title: He may have his reasons: Boney on Mahesh Babu's 'B'wood can't afford me' remark
181.article_body: During a recent media interaction, Telugu actor Mahesh Babu reportedly said that "Bollywood cannot afford" him. Reacting to the same, producer Boney Kapoor said, "I can't comment on this because I belong to both sides, Bollywood and South." "Also, Mahesh has the right to say whatever he feels...He may have his own reasons for saying this," Boney added.

182.title: Humsafar to expand doorstep diesel services to 200 more cities
182.article_body: Humsafar India, which delivers diesel at the doorstep, said on Thursday that it is planning to expand its services to 200 more cities in the current fiscal year. The startup added that it is looking to venture into e-mobile vehicle charging stations business and is negotiating with some companies. Currently, Humsafar offers services in about 100 cities across India.

183.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey to continue, submit report by May 17: UP court
183.article_body: The survey of Uttar Pradesh's Gyanvapi mosque will continue, a court said on Thursday. It further refused to remove Court Commissioner Ajay Mishra and directed the commission to submit a report by May 17. The survey was earlier ordered on a plea by five women to gain year-long access to prayers at a Hindu shrine in Gyanvapi-Kashi Vishwanath complex.

184.title: Drunk bouncer back from wedding fires in air in Mohali society, booked
184.article_body: A bouncer, Happy, was booked by Punjab Police after he fired gunshots in air in a society in Mohali on Thursday. Happy, along with his employers, had gone to attend a wedding in Ambala. Upon returning, Happy, who was drunk, fired twice in air. RWA official said that youngsters accompanying Happy apologised. However, Happy fired twice again and ran away.

185.title: These issues will break country: Sanjay Raut on Gyanvapi mosque case
185.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi mosque case, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said all this is happening to gain political benefits and these issues will "break" the country. "After Ram temple, now peace is needed," Raut added. Earlier, Congress’ Pramod Tiwari said BJP is trying to turn the case into an Ayodhya-like issue so that they can politicise it.

186.title: 2 men rape woman at knifepoint, record act on phone camera in Mumbai
186.article_body: Two men allegedly raped a 19-year-old woman at knifepoint in Mumbai's Dharavi, according to a report. The victim was reportedly asleep when the accused entered her house. While one of the accused threatened the woman with a knife, the other filmed a video of the act on his phone camera. Meanwhile, police have registered a case and launched an investigation.

187.title: Parents thrash Delhi man for stalking, molesting their 13-yr-old daughter
187.article_body: Parents of a 13-year-old girl allegedly thrashed a 37-year-old man for stalking their daughter in Delhi. The minor had complained to her parents that the accused, Irfan Khan, was stalking her on her way to tuition. When her parents followed her on May 7 and saw Khan misbehaving with her, they along with others attacked him with stones and sticks.

188.title: Didn't understand what Mahesh meant by B'wood can't afford him: RGV
188.article_body: Reacting to actor Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said, "I honestly didn't understand what he meant by Bollywood can't afford him." "Bollywood isn't a company. It's a label given by...media. An individual movie company...will ask you to do a film at a particular cost...how can he generalise Bollywood, I don't understand that," he added.

189.title: Ola Electric CMO Varun Dubey quits days after CTO's exit
189.article_body: Ola Electric's Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) Varun Dubey has resigned from the company citing personal reasons as the startup grapples with customer complaints and Ola e-scooter fires. The development comes days after Chief Technology Officer (CTO) Dinesh Radhakrishnan departed in a series of top-level exits at Ola. Arun Sirdeshmukh, head of Ola's used-car business Ola Cars, also quit recently.

190.title: Singer Adele shares pic of her new mansion said to be worth around ₹450 crore
190.article_body: Singer Adele and boyfriend Rich Paul have shared a picture of them standing outside what is thought to be the couple's first home together. The mansion, said to be worth $58 million (around ₹450 crore) was previously owned by Sylvester Stallone and is located in the Beverly Hills area of Los Angeles. "Time flies," wrote Adele while sharing the photo.

191.title: My father's entire battalion installed projector to watch my debut: MI spinner Kartikeya
191.article_body: MI's Kumar Kartikeya, who describes himself as a mystery spinner, revealed in a video for MI that his policeman father's entire battalion installed a projector to watch his IPL debut in Jhansi. Kartikeya added, "When I took my first wicket, everyone clapped for [my father] and hugged him. When he shared that video, that was an unparalleled feeling for me."

192.title: PM tears up as girl says she wants to be doctor because of visually challenged father
192.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was seen tearing up while speaking to a visually challenged man and his daughter who studies in Class 12 in Gujarat. Ayub Patel said his vision was affected after adverse reaction from an eye-drop. Patel's daughter said she wants to be a doctor because of her father's problem and broke down, following which PM Modi got emotional.

193.title: Can't finish semi-final at 1 am, play final next day: Djokovic backs Zverev
193.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev criticising the ATP Tour for scheduling his Madrid Open final a day after his semi-final, Novak Djokovic said, "You can't finish your semi-final match at 1 am and play the final...next day." "I understand...they want to sell more tickets...but that can cause problems," added Djokovic. Zverev lost his Madrid Open final against Carlos Alcaraz.

194.title: Many Sri Lankans leave Colombo after curfew lifted temporarily
194.article_body: Hundreds of Sri Lankans crowded the main bus station of Colombo to leave the capital and return to their hometowns after the curfew was temporarily lifted till 2 pm on Thursday. The streets in the city mostly remained quiet with people going out only to get essential supplies. Notably, a shoot-on-sight order has been issued against rioters.

195.title: SC refuses interim relief to those seeking stay on LIC IPO allotment
195.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday refused to grant interim relief to petitioners who challenged amendments to the LIC Act by Finance Act of 2021 and demanded a stay on the insurer's IPO allotment process. "We're not inclined to grant any interim relief," SC said. It also sought the Centre and LIC's replies on the batch of pleas within eight weeks.

196.title: India's most valuable startup BYJU'S in talks to raise over $1 billion: Report
196.article_body: India's most valuable startup BYJU'S is in talks with banks to raise over $1 billion to fund its acquisitions, Bloomberg reported. Bengaluru-based edtech startup BYJU'S is in talks with banks, including Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan Chase & Co, for the funding to reportedly acquire another edtech company. BYJU'S last raised $800 million in funding at a $22 billion valuation.

197.title: Sri Lanka's ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa, his son and allies banned from leaving country
197.article_body: A Sri Lankan court on Thursday banned former Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, his politician son Namal and several allies from leaving the country over acts of violence against anti-government demonstrators. Police has been asked to investigate Monday's mob attacks on peaceful protesters, which led to retaliatory violence that claimed nine lives and caused widespread destruction.

198.title: It was a joke: Bella on rumours that she blacked out because of her corset
198.article_body: In a recent Instagram story, Bella Hadid reacted to the rumours of her blacking out at the Met Gala because she couldn't breathe in her corset. "I didn't say I blacked out because of my corset," she said. "I joked that I blacked out, not because of my corset but from the...anxieties and excitement of the carpet," she added.

199.title: 1 million people have moved to simple, better banking: Jupiter
199.article_body: We've opened one million bank accounts since August 2021, revealed Jupiter—a 100% digital banking app. Millennials love the 1% rewards on all their spends*, personalized Insights on expenses, nudges to save more in Pots, and seeing all their bank accounts in one place, the company announced. They say we've made banking online as easy as ordering food online, added Jupiter.

200.title: Ashwin played his role to perfection against DC: Mohammad Kaif
200.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif has praised RR's Ravichandran Ashwin for his performance against DC, stating that the all-rounder performed his role to perfection. "It was not easy to bat because the ball was stopping on the pitch," added Kaif. Batting at the number three position, Ashwin scored 50 off 38 balls to help RR post 160/6.

201.title: Indians going abroad can take precaution COVID dose as per destination nation's rules
201.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday announced that Indian citizens and students travelling overseas can now take the precaution dose of COVID-19 vaccine as required by the guidelines of the destination country. "This new facility will be available soon on the CoWIN portal," he added. Earlier, all citizens above 18 were declared eligible for precaution dose.

202.title: Germany may be able to do without Russian gas next winter: Minister
202.article_body: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck said Germany may be able to make it through the next winter without Russian gas. "If we've full storage facilities at the turn of the year, if two of...four floating LNG tankers we've leased are connected to the grid and if we make significant energy savings, we can to some extent get through...winter," Habeck said.

203.title: Ponting backed Rishabh Pant ahead of Shreyas Iyer: Ajay Jadeja
203.article_body: Talking about DC's performance in the ongoing IPL season, ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said Rishabh Pant has been good with the captaincy. "At times, when someone is made captain, you can feel that someone's guiding them. But with Pant, it's clear that he is the one calling the shots. Ricky Ponting backed Pant ahead of ex-captain Shreyas Iyer," he added.

204.title: Internet services restored in Raj's Bhilwara 2 days after 22-yr-old's death
204.article_body: The internet services have been restored in Rajasthan's Bhilwara, two days after a 22-year-old man was stabbed to death in Kotwali Police Station area. The District Magistrate on Thursday said that the situation is peaceful and appealed to the public not to pay heed to rumours. The internet services were suspended after tension escalated in Bhilwara following the man's death.

205.title: Bengaluru records lowest maximum temperature in May in 10 years
205.article_body: Bengaluru on Wednesday recorded a maximum temperature of 24.3°C, the lowest in the month of May in the last 10 years, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The temperature on May 11 was nine degrees below the normal maximum temperature. The previous lowest maximum temperature recorded in the city in the last decade was 33.8°C on May 2, 2015.

206.title: Can't force these things: Sharmila on working with daughter-in-law Kareena
206.article_body: When asked about working with her daughter-in-law, actress Kareena Kapoor in future, veteran actress Sharmila Tagore said, "It's best if it happens organically, rather than being forced." She added that the audience would like to see a well-made film at the end of the day. "We're all a family of working actors and we all enjoy our work," Sharmila said.

207.title: Meta tells Reality Labs staff it's planning cutbacks in the divison
207.article_body: Meta has told its Reality Labs employees that it's planning cutbacks in the division. Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth informed Reality Labs staffers to expect certain changes and that the division could not afford to do some projects anymore and would have to postpone others. A Meta spokesperson said the firm was not planning layoffs as part of the changes.

208.title: Action taken against encroachment not based on religion: Naqvi
208.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Wednesday, while talking about the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi, said action taken against encroachment is not based upon religion. "Action will be taken against whosoever is committing...crime, be it Congress or Mehbooba Mufti," Naqvi added. His remarks came following PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti's comments who said minorities are being targeted in the drive.

209.title: What we talked was personal, not even my brothers know about it: Rizwan on chat with Kohli
209.article_body: On being asked about his interaction with Virat Kohli after Pakistan's win against India in T20 World Cup 2021, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said, "What we talked was personal." He added, "At my home, not even my brothers know about it." Rizwan further said that he would pray for Kohli as the ex-India captain is going through a tough phase.

210.title: Rajiv Kumar appointed next Chief Election Commissioner, to replace Sushil Chandra
210.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind has appointed Rajiv Kumar as the next Chief Election Commissioner of India. The announcement was made by Union Minister of Law and Justice Kiren Rijiju on Twitter. Rajeev Kumar will replace Sushil Chandra and assume the charge of the office from May 15.

211.title: Man rapes 23-yr-old woman and kills her, later rapes her dead body in Telangana
211.article_body: A 25-year old man raped a 23-year-old woman, beat her to death and then raped her corpse in Telangana. The incident took place in Choutuppal town. "We took up the investigation and using dog squads and other evidence collected from the spot, we managed to track down the suspect within 24 hours. After interrogation, we arrested him," police said.

212.title: Umran capable of playing int'l cricket, his 90% deliveries are 145 kmph: Steyn
212.article_body: Former South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has termed SRH pacer Umran Malik an "all-out fast bowler", who is capable of playing international cricket. Steyn added, "How India uses Umran is up to them...[but] one guy bowling 150 kmph consistently, I think every international team will want him. How and where you use him is critical," Steyn.

213.title: Day to reiterate appreciation: PM on International Nurses Day
213.article_body: On the occasion of the International Nurses Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said that nurses play a vital role in keeping our planet healthy. "International Nurses Day is a day to reiterate our appreciation for all nursing staff for their exceptional work even in the most challenging of situations," PM tweeted.

214.title: Finland, which shares 1,300 km border with Russia, announces bid to join NATO
214.article_body: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Finland's President Sauli Niinisto and Prime Minister Sanna Marin on Thursday said that the country should apply to join NATO "without delay". Finland shares a 1,300 km border with Russia. Finland stepped up its cooperation with the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation as a partner since Russia annexed Crimea in 2014.

215.title: Burial sites found at 53 Native American boarding schools in US
215.article_body: A US government investigation into the history of Native American boarding schools has found "marked or unmarked burial sites" at 53 of them, Interior Secretary Deb Haaland said. Many children were abused at the schools, and tens of thousands were never heard from again, activists say. The report noted "rampant physical, sexual, and emotional abuse" took place at the schools.

216.title: Law Minister has no authority to draw any arbitrary 'Laxman Rekha': Chidambaram
216.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram reacted to Law Minister Kiren Rijiju’s "Laxman Rekha" remark made after the Supreme Court ordered to put the sedition law on hold. Rijiju had said, "There’s a 'Laxman Rekha' that must be respected by all organs of the state." Reacting to this, Chidambaram said the Law Minister has no authority to draw any “arbitrary Laxman Rekha”.

217.title: 'Chintan shivir' to discuss ways to re-energise Congress: Sachin Pilot
217.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said the Congress will deliberate on ways to re-energise the party and challenge the BJP-led NDA government in the 'Nav Sankalp Chintan Shivir' to be held in Udaipur. "The Nav Sankalp Chintan Shivir in Udaipur will prove to be very important in deciding the future strategy…This conference will be result and outcome-oriented," Pilot added.

218.title: K'taka Congress asked leaders, volunteers to troll me: Ex-MP Divya
218.article_body: Former MP Divya Spandana, who previously served as Congress' social media head, accused the party's Karnataka leadership of asking leaders and volunteers to troll her. "So the 'office' has circulated these messages among the Congress leaders and volunteers asking them [to] troll me," she tweeted. She later clarified that by "office" she meant Karnataka Congress under KPCC chief DK Shivakumar.

219.title: Vacate illegally occupied govt land or face action: Punjab CM Mann
219.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Wednesday asked people illegally occupying government or panchayat land to vacate and hand the same over to authorities by May 31. He further warned of taking action against violators if such land is not voluntarily surrendered. According to Mann, the government has set a target of freeing 5,000 acres of illegally occupied land by month-end.

220.title: 39 violators nabbed for power theft in Ludhiana, ₹13.8 lakh fine collected
220.article_body: The Enforcement Wing of the Punjab State Power Corporation Limited on Wednesday conducted raids in Ludhiana and nabbed 39 persons for power theft. The Enforcement Wing fined the violators a total of around ₹13.8 lakh. Seven enforcement squads along with local police teams raided residential areas including Nandpur and Natt. "Repeated offenders will be put behind bars," an official said.

221.title: 37-year-old farmer gored to death by stray bull in UP's Agra
221.article_body: A 37-year-old farmer, Jitendra Baghel, was gored to death in a field by a stray bull in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The bull attacked him while he was trying to keep his melon field safe from stray cattle. The bull reportedly tossed him in the air multiple times. His dead body was later discovered in the field by the villagers.

222.title: Ukraine offers to swap Russian prisoners for injured fighters
222.article_body: Ukraine has offered to release Russian prisoners of war in exchange for the evacuation of severely injured Ukrainian fighters trapped inside the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, the last remaining pocket of Ukrainian resistance in the city. Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk said negotiations are underway regarding the proposal. The Azovstal fighters have refused to surrender to Russian forces.

223.title: Schemes not just on paper: PM Modi hails Bharuch's Utkarsh Initiative
223.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday lauded the 'Utkarsh Initiative' by Gujarat's Bharuch district, under which financial assistance was provided to widows, elderly and destitute citizens. "Sometimes the schemes remain only on paper. But when the intention is clear, the policy is clear…there is a spirit of development for all, then we see results," said PM Modi in a virtual address.

224.title: People raise slogans ahead of demolition drive in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar
224.article_body: People on Thursday protested against the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar ward and raised slogans ahead of the drive. The drive was announced by the civic body. AAP's Amanatullah Khan, who is present at the location said, "I'm ready to go to jail if it saves poor people's houses." Anti-encroachment drive also took place at Rohini's KN Katju Marg.

225.title: Nobody cares for your story till you win: Sanjay Dutt on pic from gym
225.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt took to social media to share a picture of himself from a workout session, with the caption, "Nobody cares about your story till you win, so win!" "Baba you are always [a] winner, one will need 1000 guts to face what you have faced. You are...[an] inspiration to many," read a reaction on Twitter from a fan.

226.title: Inter-state drug racket busted in Hyderabad, 358 kg marijuana seized
226.article_body: Police arrested two inter-state drug peddlers in Hyderabad and seized 358 kilograms of marijuana from their possession. "They procured marijuana in dry form from Andhra Pradesh's Maredumilli at low rates and sold it at higher rates," police said. "They purchased each kilogram for ₹3,000 and planned to smuggle it to Mumbai to sell at ₹20,000 per kilogram," police added.

227.title: CSK unfollow Ravindra Jadeja on Instagram, CEO denies rumours of rift
227.article_body: CSK unfollowed Ravindra Jadeja on Instagram, sparking rumours of a rift. Following this, CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan told The Indian Express, "I've no knowledge of what's going on there." Rubbishing rift rumours, he added, "What I can tell you is that from the management side, there has been no problem and whatever is there on social media, I'm not aware."

228.title: Coinbase's bankruptcy could put customer assets at risk: Zerodha CEO
228.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath while discussing Coinbase's latest filing cautioned Indian investors and said, "Customer assets could be at risk in case of bankruptcy." "Indian crypto investors on exchanges also need to be aware of this. Unlike...stock market where stocks are held in a Demat...crypto with exchanges carry a risk," he added. Coinbase, however, has denied facing bankruptcy risk.

229.title: To each his own: Suniel Shetty on actors being questioned for endorsing tobacco products
229.article_body: Talking about actors being questioned for endorsing tobacco products, Suniel Shetty said, "To each his own...Alcohol and tobacco get sold...which is why they're advertised." He added, "Those who don't want to consume it should refrain from doing so." Adding that he doesn't consume tobacco, Suniel said, "That doesn't mean I'm a saint...I won't say I'm right and others are wrong."

230.title: 24-yr-old man attacks fruit-seller with knife in Delhi, arrested
230.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly attacking a fruit-seller with a knife in Delhi's Prashant Vihar area, police said. The accused, who is also a fruit-seller, reportedly attacked Sonu Kumar over some previous enmity. On Monday, an altercation broke out between the two, following which the accused attacked Kumar with a knife used to cut coconut, police said.

231.title: I went on 50 dates in 2019, I was 39: 'Jojo Rabbit' actress Rebel Wilson
231.article_body: Australian actress Rebel Wilson who starred in Oscar-nominated film 'Jojo Rabbit' said she went on 50 dates in 2019 at the age of 39. "I went on some dates with...billionaires and then also some people who had nothing," added Wilson. "The last person I went out with...I did get the FBI to...check them out," stated Wilson.

232.title: Massive fire in canteen stirs panic at UP's Moradabad railway station
232.article_body: A major fire broke out at a canteen on platform number 5 of Moradabad railway station at 2:30 am on Thursday. This triggered panic among people and they started running in all directions, police said. Fire brigade was, however, sent immediately to the spot. No casualties were reported in the fire suspected to be caused due to loose wires.

233.title: After injury, COVID, I felt I was batting with the wrong end of my bat: Marsh
233.article_body: Speaking about how he struggled to find rhythm due to an injury and then testing positive for COVID-19 in IPL 2022, DC all-rounder Mitchell Marsh said, "I felt I was batting with the wrong end of my bat." Marsh was named Man of the Match for his performance against RR on Wednesday. The 30-year-old picked two wickets and scored 89(62).

234.title: UK pledges military help to Sweden & Finland if attacked
234.article_body: The UK has signed security deals with Sweden and Finland, agreeing to come to their aid, including with military support, if either nation comes under attack. UK PM Boris Johnson visited both Nordic nations to sign the pacts amid debate about them joining NATO. Russia has warned of "military and political repercussions" if Sweden and Finland decide to join NATO.

235.title: Delhi HC judge asks is it rape if husband forces wife for sex, MP Priyanka replies
235.article_body: Hearing marital rape case in Delhi High Court, Justice C Hari Shankar said, "A husband may, on occasion, compel his wife to have sex...Can it be said...her experience is the same as that of a woman who is ravaged by stranger?" MP Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted, "The experience of outrage, disrespect and violation is just as strong. Ask women around you."

236.title: 5 from Maharashtra die after vehicle rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway
236.article_body: At least five persons from Maharashtra, including four women, were killed and two got injured after the vehicle they were travelling in rammed into a truck on Yamuna Expressway, police said. They were declared brought dead after they were rushed to a hospital, police added.  The police suspect that the accident happened after the driver of the vehicle fell asleep.

237.title: UK PM trolled after pic of him wearing full suit while rowing a boat goes viral
237.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson was trolled after a picture of him wearing full suit while rowing a boat went viral on social media. Johnson was accompanied by Swedish Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson. Reacting to the picture, a social media user wrote, "Boris Johnson is like 'I've rowed in suits all my life and I'm gonna be alright'."

238.title: For me, my dad is my God; I will not act in his biopic: Mahesh Babu on father
238.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu said that for him, his father Krishna is God and that he will never act in his biopic. "I would rather love to produce if the subject can be dealt properly," he added. Meanwhile, Mahesh Babu had recently said that he doesn't want to waste his time in Bollywood as the industry can't afford him.

239.title: I've had a really s***ty time: Camila Cabello on body image issues
239.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello spoke about her "ever-present struggle" with body image under the limelight of being a celebrity. "People...often look at these pictures of celebrities and want to change their diet or aspire to that," Camila said. "I might look a certain way but I've had a really s***ty time and that's not a good way to be," she added.

240.title: Postpone NEET PG 2022 scheduled for May 21: IMA to Health Minister
240.article_body: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) on Wednesday wrote a letter to Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya requesting him to postpone the NEET PG 2022, which is scheduled to be held on May 21. It said that the aspirants have been given very little time to prepare for the exam owing to the delay in last year's exam and counselling.

241.title: Railway station near Somnath temple to be redeveloped at ₹134 cr
241.article_body: The Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA) has decided to redevelop the railway station near Somnath temple in Gujarat at an estimated cost of ₹134 crore. "The upgradation...will strengthen tourism prospects of the area," stated RLDA vice-chairman. The proposed upgradation will include civil work along with an exclusive building façade exhibiting local heritage of Somnath temple.

242.title: No need to panic: K'taka Health Minister on reports of tomato flu in Kerala
242.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar has asked people not to panic on reports of tomato flu in the neighbouring state and said, "It is endemic to Kerala." He added that the authorities in border districts have been instructed to remain alert about controlling its spread. Tomato flu has been reported in over 80 children aged below five in Kerala.

243.title: 47-yr-old woman missing for 2 days found dead near society stairs in Noida
243.article_body: A 47-year-old woman, who went missing on Monday, was found dead near the staircase leading to her apartment in Noida’s Sector 137 on Wednesday. "The cause of death is termed as shock and haemorrhage," police said. The woman had earlier gone missing on May 5 too, however, her family traced her to Ranikhet and brought her back, police added.

244.title: Half of households in India do not seek govt health care: NFHS
244.article_body: Half of the households in India do not usually seek healthcare from government health facilities, according to the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5). Almost half of them do not do so because of the "poor quality of care" at public hospitals. During 2019-21, 49.9% of households did not generally use a government health facility, according to the survey.

245.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 77.55 against US dollar
245.article_body: The Indian rupee has touched a fresh all-time low of 77.55 against the US dollar. The rupee slumped 30 paise in opening trade as a lacklustre trend in the domestic equity markets and a firm American currency weighed on investor sentiment, reports said. Besides, persistent foreign fund outflows and elevated crude oil prices impacted the domestic unit, forex traders said.

246.title: There is a big question mark on Kieron Pollard's form: Parthiv
246.article_body: Ex-India player Parthiv Patel has said MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard's form is the only point of concern for MI ahead of their match against CSK on Thursday. "There is a big question mark on Pollard's form and the way he is approaching the game," he added. So far, Pollard has scored 144 runs from his 11 games this season.

247.title: Rise in locals turning terrorists in J&K in last 2 years: Report
247.article_body: The number of local youngsters to join terrorist ranks in Jammu and Kashmir has increased significantly in the last two years, said a report citing CRPF sources. The share of local terrorists in the union territory has been as high as 60% over these years, it said. Earlier, foreign terrorists, mainly Pakistanis, constituted about 60-70% of the total, said officials.

248.title: Siemens announces exit from Russian market, condemns Ukrainian war
248.article_body: German multinational conglomerate Siemens will quit the Russian market due to the war in Ukraine. "We join the international community in condemning the war in Ukraine and are focused on supporting our people and providing humanitarian aid," CEO Roland Busch said. Siemens reportedly employs around 3,000 people in Russia and had earlier decided not to take on new projects there.

249.title: 'Honey-trapped' IAF jawan arrested for espionage in Delhi; ISI involvement suspected
249.article_body: Delhi Police Crime Branch have arrested IAF jawan Devendra Sharma on espionage charges, officials said, adding that they suspect he was 'honey-trapped'. Police said a woman befriended Sharma on Facebook and tried to get information about positions of IAF radars and posting of senior officials. Officers added they suspect the involvement of Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) behind it.

250.title: Saudi Aramco dethrones Apple as world's most valuable company
250.article_body: World's biggest crude exporter Saudi Aramco has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company. The Saudi state-run oil company's market cap rose to $2.43 trillion on Wednesday after its shares surged due to higher oil prices. Meanwhile, Apple's market capitalisation fell to $2.37 trillion after its share price tanked 5.2% on Wednesday.

251.title: SRK is the 'original' gangster and occasionally acts like one: Ranveer
251.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said Shah Rukh Khan is the "original gangster" and occasionally "acts" like one. "He is the definition of a mobster," added Ranveer. "I can't wait to see him again since I adore and respect him so much," stated Ranveer. "He is a man of incomparable greatness...Shah Rukh Khan is the king for a reason," he said.

252.title: Chronological tweets are better than what algorithm suggests: Musk
252.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "Chronological tweets seem much better than what 'the algorithm' suggests." He also asked users to tap on stars present in the upper right corner of their home page to revert to chronological order. Responding to Musk, Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey said, "This is the way...Having [a] choice is the most important."

253.title: VHP leader injured in clash in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh, internet services suspended
253.article_body: A Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) leader was injured after a clash broke out between two groups on Wednesday evening in Nohar city of Rajasthan's Hanumangarh, police said. Following the clash, the district administration suspended internet services in Nohar, Bhadra and Rawatsar towns in Hanumangarh. The attack on the VHP leader took place when he tried to stop eve-teasers, police said.

254.title: Love the boy, I'd like them to take decision: Suniel on Rahul, Athiya's wedding
254.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said that he loves daughter Athiya Shetty's boyfriend KL Rahul. While talking about their marriage, he added, "It is for them to decide what they want to do, because times have changed. Both my son and daughter are responsible people. I would like them to take the decision. My blessings are always there for them."

255.title: Greece bans LGBTQ conversion therapy for minors
255.article_body: Greece on Wednesday banned LGBTQ conversion therapy for minors. Under the bill, which the Greek Parliament approved, psychologists or any other health professionals will require an individual's explicit consent to perform such treatment and would face fines and a prison term if they violate the law. Earlier this year, Canada, New Zealand, and France criminalised LGBTQ conversion therapy.

256.title: Masaba celebrates dad Vivian Richards' 70th b'day in Antigua, shares post
256.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta celebrated her father, former cricketer Vivian Richards' 70th birthday on Wednesday. Taking to Instagram, she shared pictures from his birthday celebration as they organised a charity tournament to aid healthcare workers. Alongside the post, she wrote, "To celebrate dad's 70th birthday in Antigua, a golf tournament (where he is happiest after a cricket field)."

257.title: COVID-19 death toll in US crosses 10 lakh
257.article_body: Over two years into the pandemic, COVID-19 has now claimed more than 10 lakh lives in the US, according to Reuters. The data shows one out of every 327 Americans died of the infection. The toll had surpassed the number of US' military deaths in World War I by June 2020 and that of World War II by January 2021.

258.title: BJP leaders using CAA as carrot on stick: TMC’s Abhishek Banerjee
258.article_body: TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee said BJP leaders are using the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) as a "carrot" on a stick. "CAA is a political tool and we should not get into this trap," Banerjee said in Assam. He added that Union Home Minister Amit Shah maintained silence over the CAA and NRC during his two-day visit to Assam.

259.title: Rajasthan govt has no right to continue, it’s 'anti-people': Nadda
259.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Wednesday said an "anti-people" government is in power in Rajasthan that does not understand the issues of the people. The government in the state has no right to continue in power, Nadda added. Rajasthan has the highest number of rape cases in the country but the CM is not concerned, Nadda stated.

260.title: List of 10 highest-paid sportspersons released by Forbes
260.article_body: Argentina and PSG forward Lionel Messi was the highest-paid sportsperson over the past year with earnings of $130 million, as per Forbes' list of 10 highest-paid sportspersons. It is the second time that Messi has topped the list. He is followed by LeBron James ($121.2 million) and Cristiano Ronaldo ($115 million)

261.title: Whose pressure will he have: Kangana on Big B deleting tweet promoting 'Dhaakad'
261.article_body: Reacting to Amitabh Bachchan posting a tweet promoting her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad' and deleting it after a while, actress Kangana Ranaut said that it is "so striking". "At somebody of his stature, at his level, whose pressure will he have?" Kangana added. "I find this situation a bit complex," the actress further said.

262.title: 22 people jailed for 2021 temple attack in Pak over 8-yr-old boy urinating in madrasa
262.article_body: A Pakistani anti-terrorism court on Wednesday sentenced 22 people to five years in jail each for attacking a temple in Punjab province last year. A mob had attacked the temple after an 8-year-old boy allegedly urinated in the library of a madrasa. The court acquitted 62 people, giving them a benefit of doubt, a court official said.

263.title: Had a few practice games where I opened also: Ashwin on batting at no. 3
263.article_body: RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin, who has now batted thrice at the number three position in IPL 2022, has revealed that the management had "communicated properly" that they would be using him up the order at the start of the season. "We had a few practice games where I opened  [also]," he added. Ashwin scored 50(38) against DC on Wednesday.

264.title: UP Police constable arrested for supplying drugs in Mumbai
264.article_body: Mumbai Police recently arrested a constable of Uttar Pradesh Police force for allegedly being a part of a gang smuggling Double Tiger Mark Heroin and Mephedrone drugs in the city. The police had earlier arrested two people from Malad for smuggling drugs worth over ₹1.7 crore. During interrogation, they informed about their supplier attached to the UP Police, police added.

265.title: Intact fossil of pregnant ichthyosaur recovered from glacier in Chile
265.article_body: Scientists have recovered one of world's most complete ichthyosaur fossils with intact embryos from a glacier in Chile's Patagonia region. It's the "only pregnant ichthyosaur that's been found on the planet from the era between 129 and 139 million years ago", one of the scientists said. Scientists spent 31 days extracting the fossil, which was found over a decade ago.

266.title: Shiv Sena MLA Ramesh Latke dies aged 52 during family vacation in Dubai
266.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA from Mumbai's Andheri East Ramesh Latke died of a cardiac arrest aged 52 in Dubai, a party official said. "He had gone to Dubai with his family on a vacation," the official added. "We've informed CM Uddhav Thackeray and other senior party leaders about initiating the procedure to bring his body back to India," the official stated.

267.title: When I got back, they wanted me to play mother of heroes 3 yrs younger: Sarika
267.article_body: Actress Sarika said that when she returned back to acting, she was offered roles of a mother. "They wanted me to play mother to heroes who were three years younger than me," she said, adding that ageism, when it comes to roles for female actors, is still there and that it is not something that can be changed.

268.title: The days when nothing else but love mattered are gone: Arshad Warsi
268.article_body: Actor Arshad Warsi said modern love is more practical than it should be, adding that it has crossed the line of a true feeling. "It is not just pure love. The days when nothing else but love mattered are gone," stated Arshad. "There has to be a reason and other things apart from just love," said Arshad.

269.title: Navi Mumbai Muslim group installs sound control units in city mosques
269.article_body: The Muslim community in Navi Mumbai launched an initiative to install sound control units in the city mosques on Wednesday. The community will first distribute 50 units to the mosques and 100 more would be added later. These units will ensure that the volume of azaan in the mosques is within the permissible decibel limit stipulated by the Supreme Court.

270.title: 2 booked for cheating carpet godown owner of ₹3.65 lakh in Pune
270.article_body: A case has been registered against a man and a woman for cheating a carpet business owner of ₹3.65 lakh by providing him forged property tax receipts in Pune. The 56-year-old man had reportedly approached the accused as he did not know the workings of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). The money was transferred between August 2021 and October 2021.

271.title: One booked for taking Maha MP Navneet Rana's photos during her MRI scan
271.article_body: Mumbai's Bandra Police booked an unknown person who clicked photographs of Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana during her MRI scan on May 6. "He further gave the photos to the media...made them viral on social media," the complainant, a security supervisor with the Lilavati Hospital, said. Rana was admitted to the hospital after she was released from Byculla jail.

272.title: Not cut out for Bombay if you don't have work in today's age: Aparshakti
272.article_body: Sharing his opinion on opportunities available due to OTT, actor Aparshakti Khurana said, "OTT has given...much liberty. Actors who don't have work in today's age are not cut out for Bombay or this industry." "There is something wrong with their reality check whether they have it in them," added Aparshakti. "There's some problem with their intent to work," stated Aparshakti.

273.title: Ukrainian soldiers reach Germany for 40-day howitzer training
273.article_body: More than 60 Ukrainian soldiers have reportedly arrived in Germany to get training in using howitzers. The training, which will be conducted at a German military's artillery school in Rhineland-Palatinate state, is expected to last around 40 days. The Ukrainian soldiers were flown into Germany from Poland on Tuesday. This comes amid Ukraine's ongoing war with Russia.

274.title: I'll never be Twitter CEO again: Co-founder Jack Dorsey
274.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey, in response to a tweet saying Elon Musk will eventually ask him to be the CEO, said, "Nah I'll never be CEO again." On being asked if he would like such a prospect, Dorsey said, "Nah. It's time to roll the dice again." He also said no one should be Twitter's CEO ultimately.

275.title: Used to be cagey about expressing myself, felt judged: Ranveer on his costumes
275.article_body: Discussing his dressing sense and costumes, actor Ranveer Singh said, "I used to feel cagey [and judged] about expressing myself. I would alter my way of being in accordance with the effects those judgements were having." "At one point I let that go. I was like, people are gonna judge anyway so...dress the way you want," added Ranveer.

276.title: Ratna didi & I fought about clothes but never about sharing space: Supriya
276.article_body: Actress Supriya Pathak said that she and her sister, actress Ratna Pathak Shah shared a room while growing up. "We fought about everything but never about sharing space. Since there was no other room that we could go to after a fight, we had to stick together," she added. "Ratna didi and I've had huge fights about clothes," Supriya said.

277.title: Fan stalked mom, said 'want to be daughter-in-law, I'll sweep house': Kartik
277.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that a female fan had started stalking his mother and started sending her messages on Instagram. Kartik said that the fan said that she wants to be his mother's daughter-in-law. "[She said] I will even sweep your house," he added. He mentioned that the incident took place recently.

278.title: TMC to reach all parts of Assam by end of 2022: Abhishek Banerjee
278.article_body: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee said that by the end of 2022, the party will have an office at booth-level in all parts of Assam. "Every like-minded party which wants to defeat the BJP (in Assam), we invite them to join us for a combined fight," Banerjee added. "We are here because we are concerned about issues in Assam," Banerjee stated.

279.title: Ukraine commander asks Musk for help, tweets 'People say you come from another planet'
279.article_body: The commander of a Ukrainian Marine Brigade has appealed to Elon Musk to help soldiers escape a steel plant besieged by Russian forces in Mariupol. Major Serhiy Volyna tweeted, "Elon Musk, people say you come from another planet to teach people to believe in the impossible...Help us get out of Azovstal...If not you, then who? Give me a hint."

280.title: India reports 2,827 new COVID-19 cases, 24 deaths in 24 hours
280.article_body: India has reported 2,827 COVID-19 cases, 3,230 recoveries and 24 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,897 COVID-19 cases and 54 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,067, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,181.

281.title: Google unveils new 10-shade skin tone scale to address bias in products
281.article_body: Google unveiled a new 10-shade skin tone palette at its I/O developer conference that it's incorporating into several of its products over the coming months. The Monk Skin Tone Scale is designed to replace outdated skin tone scales that are biased towards lighter skin. Beauty-related Google Images searches such as 'bridal makeup looks' now allow filtering results based on Monk.

282.title: Man accused of brandishing sword during Khargone violence in MP held
282.article_body: Police on Wednesday arrested a man, identified as Irfan, who had allegedly brandished a sword during Khargone violence on Ram Navami in Madhya Pradesh. Notably, the man was chased by the Superintendent of Police (SP) but had managed to escape from the spot, an official said. Irfan's accomplice had fired at the SP leaving him injured, the official added.

283.title: BJP MLA, 25 others get 2 yrs rigorous imprisonment for gambling in Guj
283.article_body: A court in Gujarat's Halol sentenced BJP MLA Kesarisinh Solanki and 25 others, including seven women to two years of rigorous imprisonment in a gambling case. All the convicts were arrested while gambling during a raid at Jimira Resort at Shivrajpur village on July 3, 2021. Convicting the MLA, the court said, "If he is shown...leniency...it'll...send out a wrong message."

284.title: BMC launches 'Safe School' project to make roads near schools safe for kids
284.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday launched 'Safe School' project to make roads and footpaths around the periphery of schools in Mumbai safe for children. "As part of...project, we'll reengineer footpaths outside schools and paint road markings and zebra crossings using bright colours," an official said. Existing furniture on footpaths will also be revamped, the official added.

285.title: Anushka Sharma praises Virat Kohli for laughing at jokes about his bad form in interview
285.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to her Instagram Stories to praise her husband, RCB batter Virat Kohli, for laughing at jokes about his bad form in a recent interview. Anushka wrote, "If you cannot laugh at yourself, you may be missing the colossal joke of the century." Kohli was seen laughing when the interviewer asked him about his "pet ducks".

286.title: We will make it right next season: MI's Ishan Kishan
286.article_body: With MI being at the bottom of the IPL 2022 points table, opener Ishan Kishan said they will "make it right next season". On his own performance, Ishan said, "[Initially], my focus was on giving good starts to the team. But later on, somewhere I was trying to finish the games...maybe I lost my focus in first six overs."

287.title: Google teases smart glasses prototype that translates languages in real time
287.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Wednesday teased a pair of smart glasses capable of translating languages in real time during Google's I/O developer summit. The company claimed that someone with the augmented reality glasses might be able to understand what another person is saying just by reading captions that are presented through the lenses while the other person speaks.

288.title: Bihar man arrested for sacrilege attempt at Ambala gurudwara
288.article_body: Haryana Police arrested a man from Bihar for allegedly attempting sacrilege at Defence Colony Gurudwara in Ambala Cantonment on Wednesday. Police said the CCTV footage of gurudwara showed that the man entered the main hall in the morning, paid obeisance and attempted to pick up a kirpan displayed in the sanctum sanctorum. The female devotees nearby immediately pulled him back.

289.title: I'll exhibit signs of trauma: Sophie on shooting 'heavy' Game of Thrones scenes
289.article_body: Actress Sophie Turner, who starred as 'Sansa Stark' in 'Game Of Thrones' at the age of 13, said she will "probably exhibit some signs of trauma in the future" after filming "heavy" 'Game Of Thrones' scenes as a child. "I just developed a coping mechanism of...having the most fun in between takes so that I wouldn't get traumatised," she added.

290.title: Ensure Pakistani Hindus don't have to return: Adhir writes to Shah
290.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Wednesday wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah asking him to ensure that Pakistani Hindus who came to India seeking citizenship to escape religious persecution don't have to return. This comes after a report said that over 800 Pakistani Hindus had returned. In another letter, Chowdhury asked Shah to withdraw the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.

291.title: Class 12 student tries to stop fight in Delhi market, stabbed to death
291.article_body: A 19-year-old class 12 student, Md Sameer, was stabbed to death after he tried to stop a fight involving three people, Noor Hasan, Rihana and Praveen, in a market in North Delhi. Sameer tried to stop Noor who had started stabbing Praveen, after which, he stabbed him. Reports said Noor was under influence of alcohol. Sameer was rushed to hospital.

292.title: Very disappointing, we were a few runs short, a few wickets short: Samson
292.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said that it was "very disappointing" to lose against DC on Wednesday. He added, "We were few runs short, and few wickets short in the middle...While bowling second we dropped a few catches. Really disappointed." DC chased down RR's 160-run total in 18.1 overs to register their sixth win in the ongoing IPL season.

293.title: Musk's delay in disclosing Twitter stake under probe by US SEC: WSJ
293.article_body: The US SEC is investigating Tesla CEO Elon Musk's delay in disclosing his Twitter stake last month, the WSJ reported. Musk had revealed his 9.2% stake in Twitter to SEC on April 4, a delay of at least 10 days since surpassing the 5% threshold for revealing a shareholding. Musk has lately been embroiled in a dispute with the SEC.

294.title: U'khand CM deploys 2 cabinet ministers for safe, secure Char Dham yatra
294.article_body: Amid a heavy rush of pilgrims to the Char Dham shrines, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has deployed two cabinet ministers to streamline, smoothen and secure the 'yatra' arrangements. Cabinet minister Subodh Uniyal has been asked to look after the arrangements for Badrinath Dham while Dhan Singh Rawat has been asked to look after the arrangements for Kedarnath Dham.

295.title: 2 arrested with 200 grams of MDMA worth ₹20 lakh in Bengaluru
295.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru police have arrested two people for alleged drug peddling and seized MDMA worth ₹20 lakh from them, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Wednesday. The arrest was made within Marathahalli Police Station limits. Police also seized two mobile phones and an electronic weighing machine from the accused.

296.title: In a bid to destroy evidence, burglars set Pune house on fire after theft
296.article_body: In a bid to destroy evidence, burglars who had broken into a house in Pune and left with ornaments and cash worth ₹2 lakh, set the house on fire before leaving. The family had gone on a pilgrimage to Vaishno Devi Temple. They rushed back after the neighbours informed them of the fire in their house.

297.title: Terrorist killed in encounter with forces in J&K's Bandipora
297.article_body: A terrorist was killed by the security forces in a gunfight that broke out in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora on Wednesday, said police. According to police sources, a joint team of police, army and paramilitary forces were searching the area on the basis of information about presence of terrorists. One AK rifle, three magazines were recovered, said police.

298.title: Hyderabad Police busts inter-state robbery gang, 5 held
298.article_body: Hyderabad Police busted an inter-state robbery gang and arrested five people in connection with the same. Police said that ₹28.20 lakh in cash, one motorcycle and three mobile phones have been recovered from the gang. This comes after the complainant claimed that his worker, who was given ₹50 lakh to hand over at his house, was robbed on March 16.

299.title: Toyota to make EV parts in India for domestic, export markets
299.article_body: Toyota Kirloskar Motor's Senior VP Vikram Gulati said the firm plans to make EV parts in India to meet domestic demand as well as for export to Japan and some ASEAN countries. It plans to start with making e-drives or electric powertrain parts used by different EV types. Gulati added Toyota aspires to make India manufacturing hub for cleaner technologies.

300.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read with 12 matches remaining?
300.article_body: DC recorded their sixth win in IPL 2022 after defeating RR. With 12 matches remaining in league stage, DC are fifth on the points table with 12 points and NRR of 0.210. RR and RCB have 14 points each, while SRH, KKR and PBKS have 10 points each. Eight teams are in contention for the remaining three playoffs spots.

301.title: Google Translate adds support for 24 new languages including 8 Indian languages
301.article_body: Google Translate is adding support for 24 new languages including eight new Indian language, the internet giant announced at its annual developer conference Google I/O 2022. Assamese, Bhojpuri, Sanskrit, Dogri, Konkani, Maithili, Meiteilon (Manipuri), and Mizo are among the added languages. Google said it is also adding indigenous languages of the Americas such as Quechua, Guarani and Aymara.

302.title: 83-yr-old Assam woman declared Indian 10 yrs after son died over citizenship case
302.article_body: An 83-year-old woman, Akol Rani Namasudra, from Assam whose citizenship was questioned 22 years back, has been declared an Indian citizen by a foreigner's tribunal. Namasudra's son Arjun died by suicide in 2012 after getting a notice from foreigner's tribunal. PM Modi had said, "Arjun didn't die for himself but for the rights of lakhs of people in detention camps."

303.title: Pics of Ashwin's unusual batting stance against DC go viral, fans react
303.article_body: Pictures of RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's unusual batting stance against DC have gone viral. Reacting to the crouched stance, a fan jokingly tweeted, "Ashwin is so humble, very down to earth guy." "IPL is his experiment lab," wrote another. Other tweets read, "Love his innovations and experimentations" and  "Ashwin never fails to entertain."

304.title: Delhi's peak power demand rises to 6,572 MW, highest ever in May
304.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand rose to 6,572 MW at 3.30 pm on Wednesday, the highest ever in the month of May, officials said. This is the seventh time in 10 days of May that the city's peak power demand crossed 6,000 MW, officials added. Delhi's previous highest peak power demand in May was 6,461 MW on May 31, 2019.

305.title: Tibet Airlines plane catches fire after skidding on runway during takeoff in China
305.article_body: A Tibet Airlines plane caught fire after skidding on the runway during takeoff in China. The airline said that all the 113 passengers and nine crew members were evacuated adding that some had been sent to hospital with mild injuries. The plane was due to fly from Chongqing in China's southwest to Nyingchi in Tibet.

306.title: Mom watched my romantic audition tape, was like 'we sent him to study': Kartik
306.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that his mother and her sister reached filmmaker Luv Ranjan's office after he told them he had actually come to Mumbai to become an actor. "The laptop...had my romantic scene...and suddenly, my mother and mausi were watching it...They were like 'Where are we sitting, we sent him to study...what he is doing now'," he added.

307.title: North Korea reports its 1st COVID-19 outbreak, imposes national lockdown
307.article_body: North Korea on Thursday officially confirmed its first COVID-19 outbreak. North Korean leader Kim Jong-un ordered all cities and counties of the country to "strictly lockdown" their regions. The state media called it the "biggest emergency incident" and said that a sub-variant of the highly transmissible Omicron virus had been detected in the city of Pyongyang.

308.title: Hero Vired offers placement assurance with a new PG certificate program
308.article_body: EdTech company Hero Vired has partnered with edX and research university Georgia Tech to offer a PG certificate program in Business Analytics and Data Science in India. The company stated that the program is designed for early or mid-career professionals to help them make data-driven business decisions. It includes placement assurance and 25+ live sessions with global and Indian faculty.

309.title: India’s biggest poker tournament, PokerBaazi's EndBoss is back
309.article_body: PokerBaazi announced that following the success of its first two editions of EndBoss tournament, it's hosting India's biggest poker tournament from May 18-22 with a ₹5 crore guaranteed prize-pool. It gives players 5 chances to reach the final on May 22, promising a guaranteed ₹1 Crore prize to the winner. Tournaments to qualify for EndBoss start at ₹1 on PokerBaazi.

310.title: DC defeat RR to record their 6th victory in IPL 2022, get to 12 points
310.article_body: DC defeated RR by eight wickets in their IPL 2022 clash on Wednesday. DC have now won six matches in the tournament and are fifth on the points table with 12 points. RR put up a total of 160/6, driven by Ravichandran Ashwin's 50(38). Mitchell Marsh's 89(62) and David Warner's 52*(41) helped DC chase down the target in 18.1 overs.

311.title: Step up exports to $100 bn for $1 tn economy by 2030: Tamil Nadu CM
311.article_body: Tamil Nadu's export share stands at $26 billion and this should be increased to $100 billion by 2030, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said. He added that this would help meet the Centre's target of achieving $1 trillion economy by 2030. The southern zone's share in India's exports will increase from 27% to 35% in five years, he further said.

312.title: Not Hindus or Muslims, whole nation is in danger: Abhishek Banerjee
312.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee said, "Not just Hindus or Muslims, but entire India is in danger." Criticising the BJP government during his Assam visit, he said, "The BJP government is busy making movies tax free and hiking petrol prices." Banerjee also alleged that the BJP was indulging in politics of hatred and dividing the country.

313.title: Punjab budget will be in line with people’s expectations: Minister
313.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema said that the state will present a comprehensive budget, which will be in line with people's expectations. Cheema added that Punjab CM Bhagwant  Mann had promised that the budget would be formulated as per people's wishes and expectations. He also criticised the previous governments for not formulating a concrete policy for Punjab's development.

314.title: NCP has never disturbed MVA: Jayant Patil to Nana Patole
314.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil said that NCP has never tried to disturb the ruling coalition Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government comprising of Shiv Sena, NCP and Congress. Patil's statement came after Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole said that NCP stabbed Congress in the back. Patole was referring to NCP joining hands with BJP during Gondia Zilla Parishad elections.

315.title: Teak wood worth ₹80 lakh seized in Madhya Pradesh's Guna
315.article_body: The forest department confiscated over 4,000 illegally cut teak wood logs worth ₹80 lakh and a wood cutter machine after they conducted a raid in Binaganj village of Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, officials said. The operation was a joint raid by Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan forest departments. Teak wood was illegally cut and smuggled to Rajasthan from here, officials added.

316.title: Can't recognise Depp from clips of trial: Ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey
316.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey, speaking about the actor's defamation trial against Amber Heard, has said, "I haven't watched any of it...But from clips...I've come across, I don't recognise the person." "It's nothing to do with anything that I've ever experienced, and it makes me sad," she added. Jennifer and Depp were engaged in the late 1980s.

317.title: Days after BJYM worker's death, another BJP worker found dead in WB
317.article_body: Days after BJYM activist Arjun Chaurasia was found hanging in an abandoned building in Kolkata, another BJP activist, identified as Krishna Patra, was found dead on Wednesday in East Midnapore district. West Bengal BJP President Sukanta Majumdar blamed TMC for his death. He claimed that Patra was "abducted from his house and killed by TMC miscreants".

318.title: 60-year-old man dies while burying woman he strangled in US
318.article_body: An American man died of a "cardiac event" in his backyard in South Carolina while burying a 65-year-old woman he strangled, local authorities said. Officials responded to reports of an unresponsive man in the town of Trenton and found 60-year-old Joseph McKinnon dead. "McKinnon had no signs of trauma and natural causes were suspected," said officials.

319.title: Free pilgrimage, power for citizens; BJP govt failed in Guj: Delhi CM
319.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday promised free pilgrimage for senior citizens to various religious places if the AAP was voted to power in Gujarat. He also promised free electricity, better schools and hospitals, adding that the BJP government failed on multiple fronts in the state. "The AAP is a party of educated, honest and patriotic people," he said.

320.title: Man's mutilated body found on railway tracks in Punjab's Ludhiana
320.article_body: Government Railway Police (GRP) officials said that a mutilated body of a man was recovered from the railway tracks in Punjab's Ludhiana. Officials added that the deceased is yet to be identified, and the body was found on the track where goods trains ply. "It is an accident and not suicide," a GRP officer investigating the case said.

321.title: Govt eases environmental rules for coal mines to tackle fuel crisis
321.article_body: The Centre has eased environmental approvals for expansion of coal mines to boost output amid the ongoing fuel crisis across the country. A government note said the move will enable raising coal production by a further 10% without requiring new impact assessments. Rules on consulting local residents about the expansions have also been loosened, the note added.

322.title: Will appoint a new PM and cabinet this week, says Sri Lanka President
322.article_body: Amid crisis in Sri Lanka, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa addressed the nation and said he was working with all party leaders to establish a new government in the country. He said a new Prime Minister will be appointed within a week, according to local media. "I'm going to appoint the PM and...cabinet that has the trust of the people," he stated.

323.title: Birds fall from sky in Gujarat amid heatwave; pics show their rescue
323.article_body: Dozens of exhausted and dehydrated birds are dropping everyday in Gujarat amid heatwave, veterinary doctors and rescuers have said. "This year has been one of the worst in the recent times. We've seen a 10% increase in the number of birds that need rescuing," non-profit Jivdaya Charitable Trust's official said. Pictures showing veterinary doctors treating the birds have also surfaced.

324.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz meets brother Nawaz Sharif in London, video surfaces
324.article_body: Newly-elected Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif on Wednesday met his brother and Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz supremo Nawaz Sharif in London, the party tweeted and shared a video. Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz Sharif also shared a picture of the Sharif brothers and captioned it "Mashallah". Nawaz Sharif, who was convicted in two corruption cases, has been living in London since 2019.

325.title: Many in B'wood don't praise me due to their own insecurities: Kangana
325.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, speaking about Bollywood, has said, "These people don't want to praise me. Sometimes, I feel there is no lobby but people have a lot of their own insecurities." However, she added that she met Kiara Advani and she praised her. Kangana also said that everyone at a Bollywood party was talking about her 'Dhaakad' trailer.

326.title: Haryana announces Anti-Terror Squad after blast in Punjab's Mohali
326.article_body: The Haryana government on Wednesday said it will constitute an Anti-Terror Squad after a blast at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali on Monday. Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has asked senior officials to ensure all important buildings in the state are covered by CCTV cameras. He added that there is a need to increase security in the state.

327.title: Discussed caste census: Tejashwi on meeting with Bihar CM Nitish
327.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar at a closed-door meeting on Wednesday evening and said that the two discussed caste census and other issues. "I also raised the issue of unemployment and requested him to fill the vacant posts. He asked me to keep faith in him," Tejashwi said.

328.title: Book on PM Modi to become 'Gita' for people in politics: Amit Shah
328.article_body: During the launch of the book 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery', Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that it will "become equivalent to the Gita" for those who believe in social work and politics. He said PM Modi's three decades of early struggle gave him the strength to understand crucial problems and make policies for everyone.

329.title: Why did Depp's lawyer celebrate as Amber mentioned Depp allegedly pushing Moss?
329.article_body: During her testimony in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, Amber Heard mentioned Kate Moss being allegedly pushed down the stairs by Depp, who dated Moss. Following this, Depp's lawyer fist-pumped. Experts explained this could give Depp's team chance to dispel the supposed rumour, said New York Post. It could open door for Depp's attorneys to call Moss as witness.

330.title: Ravindra Jadeja ruled out of remaining IPL 2022 matches
330.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the remaining matches of IPL 2022 owing to a bruised rib. He had sustained the injury during CSK's match against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on May 4. Jadeja scored 116 runs and took five wickets in 10 IPL 2022 matches.

331.title: Iran's artillery fire hits 'terrorist bases' in Iraq's Erbil: Report
331.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards' artillery fire hit "terrorist bases" in Iraq's Erbil on Wednesday, according to a report. However, no casualties were reported in the shelling, which took place in a village in the Sidekan area near the Iranian border, the report added. Meanwhile, a news agency has reported that IRGC had previously targeted Iranian Kurdish militants based in northern Iraq.

332.title: Apple's top engineer quits due to company's return to office policy: Report
332.article_body: Ian Goodfellow, Apple's Director of Machine Learning, is reportedly leaving the company over its return to office policy. According to The Verge reporter Zoë Schiffer, Goodfellow told the company's staff, "I believe strongly that more flexibility would have been the best policy for my team." Starting May 23, Apple reportedly requires employees in the office three days a week.

333.title: My condom ad was called the beginning of sexual revolution in India: Pooja
333.article_body: Actress Pooja Bedi has said that British tabloids had called her controversial condom advertisement from the 1990s the beginning of the sexual revolution in India. "It won many awards and made advertising history. It was great to have been a trailblazer because of it," she stated. The advertisement, directed by Alyque Padamsee, was banned by Doordarshan.

334.title: FHRAI again urges SEBI to cancel OYO's IPO citing its losses
334.article_body: The Federation of Hotel and Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI) has once again urged SEBI to call off OYO's IPO citing massive losses suffered by the travel-tech firm in recent years. FHRAI said OYO suffered ₹3,943.84 crore in FY21. Since its inception in 2013, OYO's total turnover has fallen 69% from ₹13,413 crore in 2020 to ₹4,157 crore in 2021.

335.title: Special teams to check violation of loudspeaker rules: K'taka Minister
335.article_body: Karnataka Minister Anand Singh said that special teams will conduct surprise visits to check violations of loudspeaker rules. "Appropriate action will be taken against all those found violating decibel standards while using loudspeakers," he added. Karnataka government said that a loudspeaker shall not be used except after obtaining written permission from the designated authorities.

336.title: Parents confine 11-yr-old son with 22 stray dogs in Pune flat; 4 dead dogs found
336.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against the parents of an 11-year-old boy for allegedly keeping him confined in an apartment with 22 stray dogs in Pune. Dnyan Devi Childline's Anuradha Sahasrabuddhe said, "We also found four dog carcasses there. Even animal excreta wasn't removed." She alleged he was kept with dogs for two years and it impacted his behavioural development.

337.title: Was trolled for accent, now videos are made on my one-liners: Shehnaaz
337.article_body: Actress and former 'Big Boss' contestant Shehnaaz Gill has said that she was trolled for her accent but added that she has made it her strength. "Aaj mere one-liners pe log video banate hai (Now people make videos on my one-liners)," she added. Shehnaaz further stated, "That's why I feel nobody should be made fun of."

338.title: Ravichandran Ashwin smashes his first-ever fifty in IPL
338.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin on Wednesday smashed his first-ever fifty in IPL. Playing his 71st innings in IPL, the 35-year-old scored 50 runs off 38 deliveries while batting at number three against Delhi Capitals (DC). Ashwin smashed four fours and two sixes during his knock. Ashwin has now scored 589 runs in his IPL career.

339.title: Drug capsules found inside woman's body at Coimbatore Airport
339.article_body: Coimbatore Air Intelligence Unit officials said that 81 capsules of drugs were recovered from the body of a woman passenger, who had arrived at Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore Airport from Sharjah. "The woman had swallowed the capsules, which upon testing were found to be Methamphetamine drugs," Coimbatore Air Intelligence Unit officials added.

340.title: Guj's public debt at ₹3,00,000 cr, lowest among big states: Govt
340.article_body: At over ₹3,00,000 crore, Gujarat's public debt is the lowest among states with big populations in the country, the state government said on Wednesday. "Gujarat's debt is only 16% of its GDP against 22 to 24% in other states," said Education Minister Jitu Vaghani. He added that road projects worth ₹12,200 crore will be completed by October this year.

341.title: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecasts by 30 bps
341.article_body: Morgan Stanley has lowered its forecasts for India's GDP growth to 7.6% for FY23 and 6.7% for FY24, 30 basis points lower than the previous estimates. Both inflation and the country's current account deficit will likely get worse, it said. The report cited a global slowdown, surging oil prices and weak domestic demand as some of the reasons.

342.title: MHA staffers among 14 arrested by CBI in corruption probe over FCRA licence
342.article_body: CBI on Wednesday arrested 14 people, including Home Ministry staffers, in its corruption probe in the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) division of the Ministry. The arrests were made for committing violations of FCRA provisions and facilitating illegal clearances in lieu of bribes. CBI had raided 40 locations across India in this connection on Tuesday.

343.title: Delhivery IPO subscribed 21% on Day 1, retail portion booked 30%
343.article_body: Logistics unicorn Delhivery's IPO got subscribed 21% on the first day of subscription on Wednesday. The IPO received bids for 1.32 crore shares against 6.25 crore shares on offer, according to data available with the NSE. While the retail investors bid for 30% of the shares reserved for them, employees booked 6% and non-institutional buyers booked 1% of their portions.

344.title: Delhi's daily COVID-19 cases fall to 970, positivity rate dips to 3.34%
344.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 970 new cases of COVID-19 as compared to 1,118 cases recorded on Tuesday. The city also saw one death due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate dropped to 3.34% from Tuesday's 4.38%. The number of active COVID-19 cases stood at 5,202, while it was 5,471 the previous day.

345.title: Health, digital adoption among '5 megatrends' for the future: Tata Sons Chairman
345.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has listed 'Digital adoption', 'Supply chain rebalance', 'Sustainability', 'Health' and 'Global talent pool' as the "five megatrends" for the future. He said these will have a "big impact" on economies, countries and businesses globally.  "All businesses will have to become AI and data businesses...No industry can escape this trend," he said on digital adoption.

346.title: BJP govt in UP doesn't want Azam Khan to come out of jail: Akhilesh
346.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said that the BJP government in UP doesn't want Azam Khan to come out of jail. "Under pressure from the government, some officers imposed wrong cases on him. We are hopeful that he will be released soon," he added. There are a total of 88 cases registered against Khan.

347.title: Apni beti ko sambhal: Farah to Chunky Panday on 'overacting' comment
347.article_body: Farah Khan shared a video, featuring Ananya Panday, on Instagram in which she tells Ananya that she's won a National Award for 'Khaali Peeli'. Later, Farah used Ananya's father Chunky Panday's line from 'Housefull', "I'm joking." Chunky commented, "Farah you should get the award for overacting in this video." To this, she replied, "Apni beti ko sambhal (Handle your daughter)."

348.title: SL's economy will collapse if no new govt in 2 days: Central Bank chief
348.article_body: Sri Lanka's Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe on Wednesday said, "If there is no government in the next two days, the economy will completely collapse and no one will be able to save it." "I'll resign if there is no immediate action to form a government," he added. Notably, Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa had resigned amid the economic crisis.

349.title: UP DGP Mukul Goel removed for disobeying orders, lacking interest in work: Reports
349.article_body: Uttar Pradesh DGP Mukul Goel has been removed from his post and transferred to Civil Security, according to reports. He was transferred after it was found that he was disregarding orders and was not taking interest in departmental work, the reports added. The name of new DGP of the state is yet to be announced.

350.title: Why should we go to another industry: Mahesh Babu on 'B'wood can't afford me' remark
350.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu, who courted controversy for saying 'Bollywood can't afford me', stated, "I've always wanted to do Telugu films."
