"I've always wished for Telugu movies to do well across the country. I strongly feel, why should we go to another industry by leaving ours behind?" he added. Mahesh further clarified that he respects all languages.

351.title: Punjab govt revises security of 8 leaders including Harsimrat Badal
351.article_body: The Punjab government has revised the security cover of eight political leaders, including former CM Rajinder Kaur Bhattal, former Deputy CM OP Soni, SAD MP Harsimrat Kaur Badal and Congress leader Sunil Jakhar. In total, 127 police personnel and nine vehicles have been withdrawn from the eight leaders. The government cited no specific threat to the leaders.

352.title: 62 kg heroin worth ₹434cr seized from trolley bags at Delhi airport
352.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence has seized 62 kg of heroin worth ₹434 crore at the Indira Gandhi International Airport air cargo complex in Delhi. This is one of the biggest seizures of heroin till date through courier or cargo or air passenger modes in India, the Finance Ministry said. It was concealed inside hollow metal tubes of 126 trolley bags.

353.title: Akshay, Nawazuddin, Madhavan to walk on 2022 Cannes red carpet: Report
353.article_body: Actors Akshay Kumar, Nawazuddin Siddiqui and R Madhavan are reportedly among the Indian celebrities who will walk on the red carpet at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival. Music composer AR Rahman and actress Pooja Hegde will also reportedly feature on the red carpet. The Indian delegation at the Cannes will be led by Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur.

354.title: Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma cremated with full state honours
354.article_body: Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma was cremated with full state honours in Mumbai on Wednesday. Shivkumar passed away, aged 84, on Tuesday due to cardiac arrest. His funeral took place at Vile Parle's Pawan Hans Crematorium. Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bachchan paid their tribute to Pandit Shivkumar at the funeral. Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain also attended the funeral.

355.title: Respect human rights, listen to hopes of people: Pope to SL leaders
355.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday urged the Sri Lankan authorities to respect human rights after violent clashes erupted in the country over the government's handling of the economic crisis. "I appeal to...those who've responsibility to listen to...hopes of the people, guaranteeing full respect for human rights and civil liberties," Francis said. At least eight people have been killed in the clashes.

356.title: Only Congress can defeat BJP at the national level: Sachin Pilot
356.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that if there is any party that can defeat BJP and NDA at the national level, it is the Congress party. Pilot's comments came before Congress' "Nav Chintan Shivir" in Udaipur, which will be attended by over 400 party leaders, where they will hold discussions on how to challenge the ruling NDA.

357.title: Grandchild in a year or pay ₹5 cr: Parents who sued son, daughter-in-law in U'khand
357.article_body: A couple from Uttarakhand has moved court against their son and daughter-in-law demanding either a grandchild within a year or ₹2.5-crore compensation each from the son and daughter-in-law. "They were wedded in 2016 in hopes of having grandchildren," petitioner SR Prasad said. "I gave my son all my money...got him trained in America...I don't have any money now," Prasad added.

358.title: Govt issues guidelines for schools amid heat wave, asks schools to modify timings
358.article_body: Government issued guidelines regarding precautions to be observed by schools to combat heat wave. "Number of school hours per day may be reduced and school assembly should be conducted in covered area," it said. "Students may be allowed to wear loose and light coloured cotton material dress. Schools may relax norms regarding uniform such as neck ties," government added.

359.title: Putin is preparing for a long war in Ukraine, warns US intelligence
359.article_body: US National Intelligence's Director Avril Haines has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is preparing for a long war in Ukraine. Putin was "probably" counting on US and EU support for Ukraine to weaken as inflation, food shortages and energy prices got worse, Haines said. Putin will "likely" impose martial law in Russia to support the Ukraine war, she added.

360.title: 13-foot-long king cobra caught in Andhra Pradesh; pic goes viral
360.article_body: A snake catcher named Venkatesh rescued a 13-foot-long king cobra from a palm oil plantation in Andhra Pradesh's Ghat Road recently, a picture of which has gone viral online. A farmer had reportedly informed Venkatesh, who reached the spot and put the snake into a gunny bag and carried the reptile away after catching it.

361.title: DC to bowl first against RR, make 2 changes to their playing XI
361.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash on Wednesday. DC have made two changes to their playing XI, with Lalit Yadav and Chetan Sakariya replacing Ripal Patel and Khaleel Ahmed, respectively. Meanwhile, Rassie van der dussen has replaced Shimron Hetmyer in RR's playing XI.

362.title: Iran detains 2 Europeans for inciting 'chaos' in the country: Report
362.article_body: Iran's Intelligence Ministry has arrested two Europeans and claimed that they're "experienced agents" hired by a European country's intelligence apparatus, a report stated. The ministry alleged that the duo had travelled to Iran seeking to turn regular protests into "chaos, social disorder and instability". The arrests come during a visit by EU envoy Enrique Mora over Iran's stalled nuclear talks.

363.title: Taj Mahal land originally belonged to my family: BJP MP & Jaipur Royal Family member
363.article_body: BJP MP and Jaipur Royal Family member Diya Kumari has claimed that the land on which the Taj Mahal was built originally belonged to her family, adding, "We had a palace on that land." She added she has documents to prove the claim. Earlier, a petition sought ASI to check for Hindu idols in 22 locked doors of the monument.

364.title: Masjidein lene do, inko khoon kharaba mat karne do: Mehbooba Mufti
364.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday said, "Masjidein lete hain toh lene do, magar inko khoon kharaba karne ka mauqa mat do." "We can pray anywhere, even by the roadside. We do not need a building to pray, we (Muslims) can bow down before God at any place," she said.

365.title: Dharmendra shares still with Shabana Azmi from 'Rocky Aur Rani...'
365.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra has shared a still with actress Shabana Azmi on Twitter from their upcoming film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. Dharmendra wrote, "Ishq hai mujhe camera se...aur camera ko...Shaid mujh se (I am in love with the camera and I think the camera loves me)." The film also stars Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt.

366.title: Chinese burn 3 am oil, Americans avoid going to work at all: Musk
366.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk praised Chinese workers in a recent interview. He said, "[Chinese] won't just be burning the midnight oil...they'll be burning the 3 am oil...whereas, in America, people are trying to avoid going to work at all." Musk added that most of Tesla's competition would come from China while adding, "There are...supertalented hardworking people in China."

367.title: TDP chief Naidu writes to Amit Shah over ex-AP minister Narayana's arrest
367.article_body: After former Andhra Pradesh Minister P Narayana was arrested on Tuesday, TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah and claimed that the YSRCP-led state government made the arrest based on false evidence. Notably, Narayana was arrested in connection with a Class 10 exam paper leak case. However, a court granted bail to Narayana on Wednesday.

368.title: US inflation rises 8.3% in April, slight drop from March's 40-yr-high
368.article_body: Retail inflation in the US rose 8.3% in April from 12 months earlier, the country's Labor Department said on Wednesday. This is however below the 8.5% y-o-y rise in March, which was the highest rate in 40 years since 1981. On a month-to-month basis, prices rose 0.3% from March to April, the smallest increase in eight months.

369.title: Investors lose over ₹13 lakh crore in a four-day decline in stocks
369.article_body: A four-day decline in stocks has wiped out over ₹13.32 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms. The BSE Sensex plummeted 276 points to close at 54,088 in its fourth-straight session of decline on Wednesday. Larsen & Toubro, Bajaj Finserv, Bajaj Finance, PowerGrid, NTPC, Infosys and Maruti were among the top losers in the Sensex pack on Wednesday.

370.title: Class 12 student killed, woman injured during street brawl in Delhi
370.article_body: A class 12 student was killed while a woman was injured after a youth attacked them with a knife during a street brawl at a slum cluster in Delhi's Sarai Rohilla, police said on Wednesday. Arzu's (accused) mother and the survivor were quarrelling before the accused intervened and stabbed her and later stabbed the class 12 student to death.

371.title: Raj MLA Girraj Singh surrenders before police in engineers' assault case
371.article_body: Congress MLA Girraj Singh Malinga, who is accused of assaulting two power department engineers in the Dholpur district, surrendered before the police in Jaipur on Wednesday. He said the allegations of assault were baseless. Malinga said he met Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot in the morning and was asked to surrender before the police.

372.title: After I became a mom, designers said, 'Nothing's fitting you': Neha
372.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia recalled her postpartum depression after giving birth to her first child in 2018. "The day you give birth it's...an amazing feeling...And still trying to go to work...then...at fittings people saying 'oh but nothing's really fitting you...maybe we should work...sometime later'," she said. "It's a downward spiral but I've been through it and I've learned," she added.

373.title: Dalits unsafe in BJP-ruled states: NCP leader Mahesh Tapase
373.article_body: NCP leader Mahesh Tapase said that Dalits are "not safe" in BJP-ruled states. He said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should personally give an assurance of protecting members of the community in the country. Tapase's comment comes after the former head of Pawti Khurd village in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar announced a ban on the entry of Dalits into his fields.

374.title: IAS officer Pooja Singhal accused in ₹18 cr fraud case in Jharkhand arrested by ED
374.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested IAS officer and Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal, who is being investigated in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. Earlier, a viral video showed over ₹17 crore in cash being recovered during a raid at the house of a CA linked to Singhal.

375.title: No one's talking about the film, we're all stuck at ₹1000 cr: Manoj
375.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has said, "No one is talking about the film." He added, "No one wants to discuss the film, its performances, the other departments who have contributed in making that film." He stated everyone is stuck at ₹1000 crore. "This fight has been going on for years. I think this mess is not going to end," Manoj said.

376.title: NCP workers protest against inflation in Pune, chant Hanuman Aarti
376.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) led by MP Supriya Sule on Wednesday staged a protest in Pune against rising prices of gas and fuel. "Modiji, we are not angry with you, we are annoyed. How can you show such insensitivity? How can your government be so insensitive?" Sule said. Party activists were also seen performing Hanuman Aarti at the site.

377.title: Heat wave, rainfall warnings issued for several states over 5 days; IMD releases list
377.article_body: Heat wave conditions are very likely over Rajasthan on May 11, 12, 14 and 15 and in Madhya Pradesh on May 11, 13 and 15. They are also likely over parts of Maharashtra on May 11; Uttar Pradesh on May 14 and 15 and Haryana-Delhi and Punjab during May 12-15. Rainfall is likely over Northeast India during next 5 days.

378.title: Modi govt takes decisions that are for the good of the people: Shah
378.article_body: During the launch of the book 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery', Union Home Minister Amit Shah said, "[PM Narendra Modi] government doesn't take decisions that will please people. It takes decisions that are for the good of the people." PM Modi should be seen from a holistic view and not from an isolated view to understand his political life, Shah added.

379.title: Misleading: Air India on woman's panic attack video after boarding denied at airport
379.article_body: Air India said, "It's conveying a misleading image of Air India being apathetic towards a passenger," after a video showed that a woman allegedly suffered a panic attack at Delhi airport. In the video shared on Instagram, it was alleged the woman and her relatives were denied boarding by Air India staff due to a delay of a few minutes.

380.title: No need to panic: Maha Health Minister on rising COVID-19 cases
380.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said that though there is a rise in COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, there is no need to panic. He said that states like Punjab, Uttar Pradesh and Delhi are witnessing a similar spike, but most of the people infected have only experienced mild symptoms. "In Maharashtra, cases are rising but not rapidly," Tope added.

381.title: Punjab HC gave resounding slap to Kejriwal for misusing police: Bagga
381.article_body: Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Singh Bagga, who was arrested last week, on Wednesday said that the Punjab High Court has given a "resounding slap" to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "The country used to salute the Punjab Police which had defeated Khalistan," he said. The police is now given the job of arresting people who tweet against Kejriwal, he added.

382.title: Kashmir has startup potential in agri, dairy sectors: Jitendra Singh
382.article_body: Union Science and Technology Minister Jitendra Singh said Kashmir has huge, largely unexplored startup potential in the agriculture and dairy sectors. The youth should look beyond government jobs as a source of livelihood, Singh added. He also assured help to youth from the central government in setting up employment generating units for themselves and others.

383.title: Cummins is a world-class bowler, KKR still benched him: Shastri
383.article_body: Discussing all-rounder Pat Cummins, ex-India coach Ravi Shastri said, "Thankfully KKR...played Cummins [in their win against MI by 52 runs]. [I] wonder what he was doing warming the bench." "He is Australia's Test captain, a world-class bowler and they still benched him," added Shastri. Cummins has taken seven wickets in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 10.68.

384.title: Apple testing folding panel for iPhone and iPad: Report
384.article_body: Apple is developing a new folding OLED screen that would eventually be used in a folding iPhone or iPad, South Korea's TheElec reported. Apple is reportedly developing a polarizer-less OLED screen, the same technology which is used by Samsung in its Galaxy Z Fold3 and its Eco2OLED display. Currently, polarizer is being used in some conventional folding displays.

385.title: File 1,000 FIRs, but I'll keep asking questions: Bagga to Kejriwal
385.article_body: Criticising Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab Police over his arrest, BJP leader Tajinder Bagga said that even if a thousand FIRs are filed against him, he will continue asking questions. Bagga, who was arrested by the Punjab Police last week, claimed that he was arrested for "asking questions". Bagga said he was arrested for reminding Kejriwal of his promises.

386.title: Will take her to ISRO: Smriti Irani on UP girl aspiring to be scientist
386.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani during her visit to Uttar Pradesh's Amethi promised a girl student a visit to Indian Space Research Organisation next month. The polytechnic student had told Irani that she wanted to be a scientist and work at the national space agency. "It's a matter of pride for Amethi that [she] wants to become a scientist," Irani said.

387.title: More pressure on RR than DC, DC are like a wounded tiger: Ajay Jadeja
387.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said there is more pressure on RR than DC in their upcoming match, despite being currently placed third on the IPL 2022 points table. "DC have been so up and down that it's...difficult...to predict what RR will be up against. DC are like a wounded tiger," added Ajay. "They have everything to lose," stated Ajay.

388.title: Telling truth is not treason: Rahul as SC puts sedition law on hold
388.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday welcomed the Supreme Court's order to put the sedition law on hold. Rahul said, "Telling the truth is patriotism, not treason. Listening to the truth is one's duty...Crushing the truth is arrogance." Meanwhile, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala termed the apex court's decision as "historic" and said, "Speaking truth to power can't be sedition."

389.title: 24-year-old man stabbed to death by neighbour in Mumbai
389.article_body: A 24-year-old man, Shubham Dangat, was stabbed to death by his neighbour in Mumbai's Kurla over past enmity. Police said that the accused, Tanaji Kawar, had attacked Dangat's mother with a wooden log in 2017 and was arrested. During a heated argument with Dangat, Kawar, who was out on bail, stabbed him on his head, chest and back, police added.

390.title: 22-yr-old dials 100 citing danger to life at 2:30am, asks police to get beer in T'gana
390.article_body: A 22-year-old man has been booked in Telangana's Doulatabad for allegedly misusing the Dial100 emergency service. Police said the man, who was at a wedding, called on the number and claimed his life was in danger, following which police arrived at the spot. He then told them that he wanted two beer bottles and that the police should get it.

391.title: Jennifer Aniston to be the final guest of 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show'
391.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston will be the final guest in the farewell episode of 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show'. The actress was also Ellen's first-ever guest on the show when it began in 2003. The talk show will be ending after 19 seasons. Along with Jennifer, singers Pink and Billie Eilish will also feature in the episode.

392.title: Hyderabad airport sets up special help desk for Gulf-bound workers
392.article_body: The Hyderabad international airport has set up a special help desk that will run round-the-clock for migrant workers travelling to middle eastern countries. It is located at the international departure terminal. An official said that the presence of a dedicated migrant help desk will help in scrutinising the documents of the travellers and guide them in emigration clearance.

393.title: I mute the TV, I don't pay attention to what people are saying: Virat Kohli on critics
393.article_body: Talking about how he cuts out the outside noise amid his bad form in IPL 2022, Virat Kohli said, "You either mute the TV or don't pay attention to what people are saying. I do both of these things." Kohli has scored 216 runs in IPL 2022 so far at an average of 19.64 and a strike rate of 111.34.

394.title: Rescued after kidnap, woman jumps off 2nd floor in UP police station campus
394.article_body: A 19-year-old woman, who was rescued from Etah a week after she was kidnapped, jumped off the second floor of the Mahila Barrack in the Vijay Garh police station campus in Aligarh on Tuesday. Reports said that the woman was housed at the barracks after being rescued and has sustained serious injuries on various parts of body, including her head.

395.title: Skeletons at Punjab well found belonging to 282 Indian soldiers martyred in 1857 revolt
395.article_body: The skeletons that were dug up in Punjab in 2014 have been found to belong to 282 Indian soldiers who were martyred during India's first freedom struggle against the British in 1857, said Dr JS Sehrawat, Assistant Professor, Department of Anthropology, Panjab University. "These were excavated from a well found underneath a religious structure in Ajnala near Amritsar," he said.

396.title: Woman kills teenage stepsons in UP, police suspect property dispute
396.article_body: UP police on Wednesday arrested a woman for allegedly killing her two stepsons, aged 18 and 15. According to police, Srinavas has two wives - Kusum and Mansa Devi. Around 5 am in morning, Kusum along with her son and daughter-in-law killed Devi's children when she was not at home, police added, suspecting property dispute as reason behind the crime.

397.title: China calls WHO chief 'irresponsible' for criticising its zero-COVID policy
397.article_body: China on Wednesday defended sticking to its strict "zero-COVID-19" approach, calling critical remarks from WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus "irresponsible". Ghebreyesus had said that China's "zero-COVID-19" policy is not "sustainable" considering the behaviour of the virus. Tedros must view China's policy "objectively" and "get more knowledge about the facts", China said.

398.title: Even PM Modi’s detractors agree he is a phenomenon: VP Naidu
398.article_body: While addressing a gathering after releasing the book 'Modi@ 20: Dreams Meet Delivery', VP M Venkaiah Naidu said that even PM Modi's detractors believe he is a phenomenon. He added that while Mahatma Gandhi took the freedom struggle out of the hands of the elite to turn it into a mass movement, PM had converted developmental initiatives into mass movements.

399.title: Sri Lanka CID summons ex-PM’s security head over Monday violence
399.article_body: The Crime Investigation Department (CID) of Sri Lanka has reportedly summoned the security head of former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and other officials in connection with the violence that occurred on Monday. At least eight people have been killed and over 200 injured in the clashes amid protests over the ongoing economic crisis. Several vehicles and properties were reportedly burned down.

400.title: 19% Indian households do not use any toilet facility: NFHS report
400.article_body: According to 2019-21 National Family Health Survey (NFHS), 19% of Indian households don't use any toilet facility and defecate in open as compared to 39% in 2015-16. Bihar has the lowest access to toilets at 62%, followed by Jharkhand (70%) and Odisha (71%). Moreover, 11% of urban households use a shared facility as compared to seven percent of rural households.

401.title: UK mulls law to make espionage punishable by life imprisonment
401.article_body: The UK is planning to introduce a law that seeks to make espionage punishable by life imprisonment, according to a report. Currently, the maximum penalty for the offence is imprisonment up to 14 years. "The Bill will, for the first time, make it an offence to be a covert foreign spy on our soil," said UK Home Secretary Priti Patel.

402.title: If B'wood can't afford Mahesh Babu's price, then very good; to each his own: Mukesh Bhatt
402.article_body: Mukesh Bhatt, speaking to India Today, reacted to Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark. "If Bollywood can't afford his price, then very good...I respect where he comes from. He has talent and he has an 'X' value for the talent," Mukesh added. "Bollywood cannot work to his expectations, there's nothing wrong with it...To each his own," he stated.

403.title: Tiger Global marks its first seed investment in India with Shopflo
403.article_body: E-commerce enablement startup Shopflo has raised $2.6 million in seed funding from Tiger Global and TQ Ventures, making it Tiger Global's first seed investment in India. Others who participated in the funding include Better Capital as well as several angel investors. Shopflo helps D2C brands improve their checkout experience at their own websites and improve conversion rates.
